title: WCAS HISTORY 393-0-20 Approaches to History
topic: Unsettled Europe? Migration and the Making of Mode

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: News headlines about Europe's ongoing "migrant crisis" portray the present as exceptional, but in fact population displacement and migration have been the norm in 19th and 20th century Europe. This historiographical seminar explores war and population displacement, humanitarianism and relief efforts, refugees, labor migration, and colonial and post-colonial migrations. We will explore changing domestic and international responses to migration; the emergence of new ideals of human rights in response to wartime and postwar displacement; the way that race, gender, and national belonging are redefined in the process of migration; and attempts to write the history of migration from a "transnational" or international perspective.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: EVALUATION METHOD: Attendance, participation, response papers, and final paper
